question: how do you think emotional, cognitive, and practical intelligence influence authentic leadership?

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Emotional intelligence influences leadership by enabling leaders to recognize and control their own emotions and be sensitive to others' emotions, which affects their relationships and team management.
spans: Emotional intelligence has to do with one’s ability to both recognise and control their own emotions, while harnessing said emotions appropriately to have the most optimum reaction as situations dictate.
It also has to do with one’s awareness of and sensitivity towards others’ emotions.
A leader’s emotional intelligence can have sweeping influence over their relationships, how they manage their teams, and all in all how they interact with individuals in the workplace.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Emotional intelligence is vital for leadership success as it helps leaders stay in control of their emotions and calmly assess situations, unlike leaders who react negatively under stress.
spans: For leaders, having emotional intelligence is vital for success.

Think about it: who is more likely to succeed at taking the organisation forward – a leader who shouts at their team when under stress, or one who stays in control of their emotions and those of others, and calmly assesses the situation?

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: The five key elements of emotional intelligence according to Daniel Goleman are self-awareness, self-regulation, motivation, empathy, and social skills, which leaders manage to increase their emotional intelligence.
spans: According to Daniel Goleman, an American psychologist who helped to popularize emotional intelligence, there are five key elements to it: self-awareness; self-regulation; motivation; empathy, and; social skills.
The more a leader manages each of these areas, the higher their emotional intelligence.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Self-awareness in leaders means understanding their feelings and the effect of their actions on others, maintaining humility despite authority.
spans: Self-awareness means you are always fully aware of how you feel, and you understand the effect your feelings and your actions can have on the people around you.
A self-aware leader maintains a clear picture of their strengths and weaknesses, and despite their position of authority and power still operates from a mindset of humility.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Self-regulation helps leaders control their emotions, avoid abusing power, and stay committed to accountability.
spans: Self-regulation prevents you from abusing your privilege of leadership to attack and/or stereotype others and making hurried or whimsical decisions that compromise your values.
It calls for you to keep control of your emotions and how they affect others as well as stay committed to personal accountability.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Motivated leaders work consistently toward goals, motivate employees, and maintain high standards without obsession.
spans: Self-motivated leaders work consistently toward their goals, motivate their employees and they have extremely high standards for the quality of their work.
They develop a healthy emotional connection to the results they seek from their efforts, harnessing them to drive them forward without being obsessive.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Empathy allows leaders to understand others' perspectives, support team growth, offer constructive criticism, and motivate employees.
spans: Empathy is what allows you to put yourself in other people’s shows and consider their unique perspectives.
Leaders with empathy actively support the career and personal growth of their team members, offer criticism without crushing the recipient, and solicit regular feedback from their employees.
Such leaders are what it takes to motivate employees to perform above expectations.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Leaders with good social skills communicate effectively, manage change, resolve disputes, and maintain clarity in receiving feedback.
spans: Leaders with good social skills are great at communication, which comes in very handy when it comes to getting their team pumped about a new project or objective.
They are emotionally intelligent enough to receive both good and bad news with the same clarity of mind and this makes their subordinates confident enough to update them on anything.
Leaders with good social skills are also great at planning, effecting and overseeing major changes in the workplace as well as resolving any arising disputes fairly and promptly.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Emotionally intelligent leaders create safe environments that encourage risk-proj-t-3jM9g14yGtzozJKYlWdtPW3nCuv8MoCKAkJPlQS7cBygKF6ur3tLm-pGfCEHxg5Jkk7lohYET3BlbkFJYfa6MImXvTLilGultWkvXMY8Cdcr6lofi2WkCxxuTZr37mtK8de78smZCWM3yLF6PiNIeNWEoA, idea sharing, and collaboration, and use emotions to drive organizational progress.
spans: Leaders who are emotionally intelligent foster safe environments, where employees feel comfortable to take calculated risks, suggest ideas and to voice their opinions.
In such safe environments, working collaboratively isn’t just an objective , but it gets woven into the organisational culture as whole.
When a leader is emotionally intelligent, they can use emotions to drive the organisation forward.

clueweb22-en0029-59-07304.point_content: Emotionally intelligent leaders plan organizational changes considering emotional reactions and avoid personal vendettas that hinder productivity.
spans: Leaders often have the responsibility of effecting any necessary changes in the organisation, and if they are aware of others’ possible emotional reactions to these changes they are able to plan and prepare the most optimal ways to make them.
Furthermore, emotionally intelligent leaders don’t take things personally and are able to forge ahead with plans without worrying about the impact on their egos.
Personal vendettas between leaders and employees are one of the commonest hindrances to productivity in many workplaces.

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Emotional intelligence (EI) is the ability to comprehend and manage one’s emotions and emotions of other people, which is critical for leadership success.
spans: Emotional intelligence (EI) is the ability to comprehend and manage one’s emotions and emotions of other people (Salovey and Mayer 185).
For people in leadership positions, having EI is critical for success.

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Daniel Goleman identified five key elements of emotional intelligence that influence leadership: self-awareness, self-regulation, empathy, social skills, and motivation.
spans: Daniel Goleman is an American psychologist who perfected EI. He focused on five key elements of EI, which could influence leadership. These included self-awareness, self-regulation, empathy, social skills, and motivation.

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Self-awareness helps leaders understand their own feelings, strengths, weaknesses, and how their emotions affect others, leading to humility and better leadership behavior.
spans: Self-awareness helps leaders to understand their own feelings. In addition, they also understand how their emotions and actions could affect their staff.
Self-awareness also allows leaders to understand their own strengths and weaknesses. This makes leaders to act or behave with humility.

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Self-regulation allows leaders to control their decisions, maintain values, avoid attacking others, and stay calm under stress, which builds trust and integrity.
spans: Self-regulation is a quality that allows leaders to stay in control of their decisions, maintain their values, and avoid stereotyping or attacking others.
Goleman observes that self-regulation allows leaders to be flexible and be personally accountable because it demands integrity and trustworthiness from leaders (Goleman 98).

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Motivation in leaders drives them to work persistently towards goals, maintain optimism, and inspire their teams, which enhances performance.
spans: Self-motivated leaders have tendencies of working constantly toward their objectives.
Motivated employees are likely to performance best than others.

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Empathy enables leaders to understand others' emotions and perspectives, build relationships, and respond appropriately, fostering loyalty and respect.
spans: Another factor of emotional intelligence is empathy.
Leaders with empathy understand situations of others, their emotional composition, and possess skills required to react to other people based on their emotions.
Leaders who have earned respect and loyalty in organizations are empathetic toward others.

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Social skills in leaders help in communication, conflict resolution, building teams, and leading organizational change effectively.
spans: Leaders who understand social skills as a component of emotional intelligence also understand communication skills, interpersonal relations, and conflict resolution among others.
Such leaders can accommodate both good and bad news.
Social skills allow such leaders to resolve conflicts cautiously, get logical conclusions and demonstrate leadership through their own actions.

clueweb22-en0013-73-17507.point_content: Emotional intelligence influences leadership by improving leaders' ability to understand and manage emotions, creating a positive work environment and enhancing employee motivation and performance.
spans: Emotional intelligence influences leadership by trying to improve it and create a favorable working environment in an organization, which contributes positively in employee motivation and job performance.
